content: Hello, I am relatively new to rust. I have been having problems when compiling some code that uses libraries. For example, the rand library has a few examples https://github.com/rust-random/rand like monte-carlo.rs. Whenever I try to compile, in the following way: rustc monte-carlo.rs ; I get an error that tells me to consider adding a main function to monte-carlo.rs. Well, I have the main function in the file so that must not be the problem. Can someone please help me? The same is happening for other libraries. However, I only wanted to run the example in https://github.com/awslabs/shuttle . Please someone help me!!!
Can you step by step walk thought how your are trying to run these examples?
It's because of the #![cfg(all(feature = "std", feature = "std_rng"))], it configures out the crate unless those Cargo features are enabled
Yeah, I thought it was that instruction as well. But when I remove it, I cannot manage to compile it.
So, I should enable the cargo features, I will look into that, thanks
I still cannot compile, even giving the flag to set all features enable
